report_title: IBISWorld | Farm Product Storage & Warehousing in the US Sep 2023
executive_summary:
Companies in the Farm Product Storage and Warehousing industry operate bulk farm product warehousing and storage facilities. Industry performance depends on the agricultural market and related international trade, as storage companies generate revenue by transporting, storing and packing agricultural goods. Farm-level decisions on when and how much of that agricultural output to store are subject to numerous influences that may be volatile in nature. Due to this, industry performance shifts each year. For example, weather patterns affect crop yields, while global production and demand drive prices. Based on these factors, farmers decide what products to store to maximize profit in a given season. Altogether, Farm Product Storage and Warehousing industry revenue has inched downward at a CAGR of 0.8% over the past five years and is expected to total $977.8 million in 2023, when revenue will jump by an estimated 0.9%.

When farmers encounter lower commodity prices, they are more likely to store grain in anticipation of future price appreciation. In addition to domestic markets, the industry is influenced by global agricultural trade trends, as the industry facilitates the export of US crops and provides value-added services, such as grain drying and prepackaging. The appreciation of the US dollar can negatively influence industry revenue, making US goods relatively more expensive to foreign buyers. Industry performance over the past five years has been affected by increasing demand for US agricultural exports, declining domestic consumption of wheat and corn-based sweeteners and some disintermediation of storage companies from supply chains. Also, the industry was severely affected amid the COVID-19 pandemic, which negatively affected industry revenue due to declining export volumes.

Industry revenue will recover over the five years to 2028, although contending largely with the same conflicting demand trends. Due to increased demand from developing countries, US agricultural exports will remain strong. Still, a continued decline in consumption of wheat and corn-based sweeteners by health-conscious domestic consumers will hurt demand for corn and wheat storage domestically. Farm Product Storage and Warehousing industry revenue is expected to inch upward at a CAGR of 0.9% to $1.0 billion over the five years to 2028.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Increasing consumer spending surges demand for storage services
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Increased demand for food products correlates directly with increased demand for storage services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Storage service companies benefit from trade activity
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Operators provide storage and logistic services for soon-to-be exported goods.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Lower export volumes amid the COVID-19 pandemic stifled demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Nearly half of US grain production is exported to the international markets.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The agricultural price index will fall over the next five years
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: China will onshore agriculture production, taking away demand from domestic producers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Global demand for agricultural products will be strong
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Continued growth in population and per capita incomes of emerging markets will drive demand for US exports.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Genetic modification is on the rise
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Mounting demand for segregating GM and organic grains will contribute to revenue growth.

industry_definition: Companies in the Farm Product Storage and Warehousing industry operate bulk farm product warehousing and storage facilities.
key_trends: Increasing consumer spending surges demand for storage services
Storage service companies benefit from trade activity
Lower export volumes amid the COVID-19 pandemic stifled demand

market_segmentation.segment_description: Corn farmers represent the industry's largest market. Over the past five years, demand from corn farming has declined for several reasons.
Soybean farmers are the industry's second-largest market. This segment's share of revenue has increased over the five years to 2023 as demand for US soybean exports has increased.
Demand from wheat farmers has modestly increased. While wheat production has declined over the past five years, tight supplies and rapid increases in demand have pushed wheat prices higher.

This segment includes the remaining crop producers and a variety of small markets, such as industrial processing plants. This segment has increased as downstream consumers have demanded a greater variety of grains.

products_and_services.product_description: The industry provides storage services for grains such as corn, wheat, soybeans and other crops.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Corn farmers represent the industry's largest market. Over the past five years, demand from corn farming has declined for several reasons. For example, there was reduced demand from ethanol producers due to declining oil prices amid the COVID-19 pandemic. An over-supply of the crop developed, driving a decrease in the price of corn and its share of industry revenue. Also, there has been a decrease in per capita consumption of sugar and sweeteners in recent years, including corn syrups.

Soybean farmers are the industry's second-largest market. This segment's share of revenue has increased over the five years to 2023 as demand for US soybean exports has increased, particularly from China. China has been demanding more soybeans to restock its hog supply after dealing with the devastation to it hogs caused by the African Swine Fever in recent years. The China-led soybean export boom has also been bolstered by the signing of the Phase 1 trade agreement between the US in China. Also, other emerging markets, such as Egypt, Indonesia, Thailand and Vietnam also increased imports of US soybeans over the past five years.

Demand from wheat farmers has modestly increased. Wheat has not had the same benefits of genetic modification as corn and soybeans since producers determined that consumers would react poorly to altering the primary ingredient for a staple, such as bread. While wheat production has declined over the past five years, tight supplies due to suppressed demand amid the pandemic and rapid increases in demand in the following years have pushed wheat prices higher. Due to this, this segment's share of revenue has increased over the past five years. On a global scale, Russian wheat leads the market and Canada has surpassed the United States as second-largest exporter of wheat. Sanctions placed on Russia due to their invasion of Ukraine has garnered Canada and the US increased market share.

The other market has remained steady over the past five years. This segment includes the remaining crop producers and a variety of small markets, such as industrial processing plants, which convert grains into industrial products. This segment also includes sorghum, barley, oats and rice storage. This market segment has increased as a share of revenue over the past five years as downstream consumers have demanded a greater variety of grains and agricultural products.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the greatest concentration of establishments due to the region's favorable crop-growing weather and favorable shipping location. The region accounts for a quarter of the population and is home to a large number of ports used for exporting grain products. The region also supports a high level of agricultural production due to its long growing seasons, which maintains a high level of overall demand for storage services in the region.

This area of the country produces a large portion of corn and wheat, which is the primary reason for its high establishment count. The Plains region also contains a large population that demands high quantities of food.

California is a large agricultural hub for the country, but does not focus as heavily as states in the Plains region on grain production. California is also a strategic trade location, enabling storage companies to benefit from more work.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Laws in most states require that any person, partnership, corporation or company that receives grain for storage or shipment must obtain a license. The US Warehouse Act (USWA) gives the US Secretary of Agriculture the authority to license any warehouse storage company engaged in storing agricultural products meant for commerce. There are further restrictions at the state level for some regions.

The construction of storage facilities and grain elevators requires initial capital outlays. Still, many large downstream users of stored products purchase storage facilities for a producer after signing a long-term supply contract. Even if potential storage companies can construct or purchase the equipment, there is still a range of applicable regulations.

Prospective companies that wish to have any chance of success must locate their facilities in attractive areas, often near ports or major population centers to attract any initial business. Also, with the entry of third-party logistics providers into the market, contract warehousing has developed into a sophisticated business that often entails long-term contracts with clients, making it harder for potential operators to secure business.

Storage companies rely heavily on manual labor to monitor facilities, send and retrieve items to and from warehouses, label and package goods and manage inventory. Also, storage companies are reliant on highly skilled workers to operate new technologies and complex machinery.

factors_decreased_barrier.factor: Having a good technical knowledge of the product
Carrying out all necessary maintenance to keep facilities in good condition

basis_points.basis_description: Storage companies compete on price, quality of work and speed of service. Companies that are able to provide logistics planning and support services have a competitive advantage and this provides more options to buyers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: What impacts the industry's market share concentration?
concentration_points.concentration_description: The Farm Product Storage and Warehousing industry has a low level of market share concentration. Concentration has remained low among the industry's largest storage companies over the five years to 2023. The largest industry companies tend to have vertically integrated operations, which ties their businesses to various aspects of agricultural production and distribution.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Other fees continue to dominate costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other costs have increased over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 18.1% of industry revenue in 2023. These expenses mostly include administrative costs, packaging, handling and insurance.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Skilled labor is highly important, resulting in high wage costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages have increased over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 64.3% of industry revenue in 2023. This industry is labor-intensive and labor costs have remained high over the past five years. Industry operations require a certain level of management regardless of product inputs.
Profit has decreased over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 5.9% of industry revenue in 2023. Industry profit has been highly volatile over the five years to 2023.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Profit can vary considerably due to the industry's sensitivity to conditions in upstream agricultural production and commodity prices in retail and wholesale markets.

FAQs.question: What is the largest cost for storage companies?
FAQs.answer: Wages are the largest cost for storage companies, accounting for 64.3% of revenue in 2023.

FAQs.question: What is the average wage in the industry?
FAQs.answer: The average wage in the industry is $54,968 in 2023, which is lower than the sector average.

FAQs.question: What is the profit margin for the industry?
FAQs.answer: The profit margin for the industry is 5.9% in 2023, which is lower than the sector average.

FAQs.question: What are some key trends impacting industry costs?
FAQs.answer: Other fees like administrative costs, packaging, handling and insurance have increased and now account for 18.1% of revenue in 2023. Skilled labor is highly important, resulting in high wage costs at 64.3% of revenue. Increasing labor fees have hindered profit, which is at 5.9% of revenue.
